channel.title: Cricket news from ESPN Cricinfo.com
channel.description: Visit Cricinfo.com for up-to-the-minute cricket news, breaking cricket news, live cricket commentary, ball-by-ball commentary, cricket video, cricket audio and features.

item.title: Lynn's IPL under cloud after shoulder injury
item.description: The injury in the match against Mumbai Indians on Sunday was the third injury to the same shoulder in less than two years

item.title: Smith and Windward bowlers overwhelm Jamaica
item.description: A round-up of the Regional 4 Day Tournament matches that were played between April 7 to 9

item.title: Bertie Wijesinhe, pre-Test era Sri Lankan cricketer, dies aged 96
item.description: Bertie Wijesinhe, the former Ceylon-representative cricketer and coach, died on Saturday aged 96

item.title: Yorkshire stunned as Hampshire complete stirring comeback
item.description: Such was Hampshire's composure in outlasting Yorkshire in a four-wicket win at Headingley, they are clearly not suffering from feelings of inadequacy after their relegation reprieve

item.title: Trott takes his time to keep Warwickshire's hopes alive
item.description: Just after lunch, it looked for all the world as if this match was heading for a three-day finish. But Jonathan Trott had other ideas

item.title: Davies hundred leaves Essex with fading hopes
item.description: Alex Davies posted his maiden first-class century to help Lancashire set Essex 478 to win - or four full sessions to save the game - in a decidedly one-sided opening match of the Specsavers County Championship season.

item.title: Lions might rethink overseas strategy - Brad Hodge
item.description: That Gujarat Lions have managed to take only one wicket in two games has prompted the management to rethink their strategy of playing four overseas batsmen

item.title: Stevens' six routs Gloucestershire for 61
item.description: Kent's wily seamer Darren Stevens bagged 6 for 22 to help his side to secure a dramatic three-day victory in Canterbury

item.title: Babar and Hasan square the series for Pakistan
item.description: The real Guyana pitch finally stood up today after going missing for the first ODI, even though Pakistan managed to reach 282 off the back of a century from Babar Azam

item.title: Gayle chases landmark against favourite opponents
item.description: Chris Gayle is 25 short of 10,000 T20 runs ahead of Royal Challengers Bangalore's meeting with Kings XI Punjab in Indore

item.title: Rana, Pandya brothers stage stunning heist
item.description: On a high-scoring, field-first ground, fighting considerable amount of dew, Kolkata Knight Riders nearly won with an under-par 176 but failed to defend 59 in the last 23 balls

item.title: Warner, Rashid give Lions a thrashing
item.description: Rashid Khan and David Warner combined to ease Sunrisers Hyderabad to their second win of the season, and send Gujarat Lions crashing to another huge defeat

item.title: BCCI SGM adjourned; Srinivasan, Shah attend meeting
item.description: Members who were in violation of the Lodha Committee's recommendations, including N Srinivasan, NIranjan Shah and TC Mathew, were present at the meeting on Sunday

item.title: Fitness has transformed my game - Jadhav
item.description: Kedar Jadhav, whose 37-ball 69 led Royal Challengers to their first win in the IPL this season, said he has always aimed to be a match-winner for his side

item.title: Under-pressure Lions face their bogey team
item.description: Sunrisers Hyderabad have won all three of their matches against Gujarat Lions and will want to keep that momentum going

item.title: Pattinson fire completes Notts victory
item.description: Nottinghamshire took less than an hour to complete a ten wicket victory over Leicestershire on the third day of the Specsavers County Championship match at the Fischer County Ground

item.title: End of an era, end of a subculture
item.description: Misbah's and Younis' biggest contribution was the example they set, showing young players what it meant to be professional sportsmen in Pakistan

item.title: Spirited West Indies eye rare series win
item.description: The hosts shocked Pakistan with a record chase in the first ODI and are on the brink of a series win - something they haven't managed against Pakistan since 1991

item.title: Sanderson's seven sweeps Glamorgan aside in two days
item.description: Ben Sanderson led Northamptonshire to a mighty win over Glamorgan inside two days at Wantage Road with four second-innings wickets in an innings-and-22-run victory

item.title: Pattinson rouses Nottinghamshire with bat and ball
item.description: Australia James Pattinson stood out with bat and ball in a fine debut display to put Nottinghamshsire on the verge of victory against Leicestershire

item.title: Denly builds on Claydon's success
item.description: Joe Denly's second half-century of the game and a four-wicket blast by Mitch Claydon extended Kent's advantage over Gloucestershire

item.title: Essex given a reality check of Division One life
item.description: Lancashire have not lost to Essex in the Championship since 1997 and that does not look like changing in this match

item.title: Abbott's haul threatens Yorkshire's feel-good factor
item.description: Two days into Gary Ballance's reign as Yorkshire captain and a sense of bonhomie has pervaded Headingley

item.title: Footitt's spell devastates Warwickshire
item.description: A devastating spell of bowling from Mark Footitt - or perhaps that should be Mark F00000itt - powered Surrey into an overwhelmingly dominant position at The Kia Oval

item.title: Royal Challengers defend 157 despite Pant's belligerence
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore defended 157 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium against Delhi Daredevils to register their first win of the tournament

item.title: Mumbai gain Malinga but lose Rayudu
item.description: The arrival of Lasith Malinga for Mumbai Indians and Shakib Al Hasan for Kolkata Knight Riders highlights the high-profile match between the two teams on Sunday

item.title: I know my game a little better now - Mohammed
item.description: The West Indies batsman said his match-winning 91 off 58 balls played out according to his plans in the first ODI against Pakistan

item.title: Bowlers' strangle, Maxwell flash gives Kings XI success
item.description: The Kings XI Punjab bowlers restricted Rising Pune Supergiants to a total of 163 which Glenn Maxwell, on captaincy debut, helped overhaul with an over to spare

item.title: Younis Khan to retire after West Indies Tests as well
item.description: Younis Khan has joined Misbah-ul-Haq in retiring from Test cricket at the end of the tour of the West Indies in April and May

item.title: 'It's as simple as see ball, hit ball' - Lynn
item.description: Chris Lynn has said he stuck to the basics and focused on putting the bad balls away during his unbeaten 93 off 41 balls in the record opening stand with Gautam Gambhir

item.title: Shahid Afridi joins Karachi Kings
item.description: Shahid Afridi has joined Karachi Kings as "president", according to the franchise

item.title: Can disqualified office bearers attend BCCI SGM, asks CoA
item.description: The Committee of Administrators (CoA), which is in charge of the Indian board, has sought an "urgent" intervention from the Supreme Court to clear the air on whether disqualified office bearers can attend BCCI or ICC meetings

item.title: Coad stuns Hampshire after Ballance stars with century
item.description: Gary Ballance and Ben Coad starred during an action-packed opening day of the Specsavers County Championship season between Yorkshire and Hampshire at Headingley

item.title: Stevens keeps Kent out of strife after Norwell's inroads
item.description: Liam Norwell led a determined Gloucestershire bowling display in Canterbury where Kent were dismissed for 298 on the opening day of the Specsavers County Championship season

item.title: Vilas, Hameed lift Lancashire as Essex faithful rue Foster axe
item.description: Dane Vilas top-scored for Lancashire with 74 while Haseeb Hameed proved his fitness after suffering an injury scare

item.title: Broad and Pattinson serve notice of Nottinghamshire's intent
item.description: Stuart Broad and James Pattinson represent as formidable an opening attack as has taken the field at Grace Road for some little time, and Nottinghamshire's international pairing duly prospered

item.title: All-round Kleinveldt gives Northants dream start
item.description: Rory Kleinveldt took three wickets and smashed a 23-ball fifty as Northamptonshire dominated the opening day of the Specsavers County Championship season

item.title: Stoneman makes himself at home for Surrey
item.description: Not so long ago, Mark Stoneman said he hated London and could never imagine living there. But, on this evidence, he seems to be settling in rather well

item.title: Gambhir, Lynn blaze away in record chase
item.description: Kolkata Knight Riders gunned down a target of 184 without losing a single wicket - a world record in T20 cricket

item.title: Mohammed, Nurse ace West Indies' highest successful chase
item.description: Jason Mohammed shellacked an unbeaten 91 as West Indies knocked off 309 with an over to spare to register their highest successful chase in ODIs
